member.name: T:System.Reactive.IEventStream
member.summary: Provides an observable stream of events that can be used for analysis or real-time handling.
member.remarks:
Leveraging the Reactive Extensions (Rx), it's possible to build fairly complicated event reaction chains by simply issuing Linq-style queries over the event stream. This is incredibly powerfull, as explained in http://kzu.to/srVn3P.
The stream supports two types of events: arbitrary event payloads (not even restricted to inherit from as is usual in .NET) or , which is an interface similar to the concrete implementation found on Rx. The advantage of pushing the event pattern version is that subscribers can perform additional filtering if needed depending on the event sender.
See also .
